field.name: In Ghana, sickle cell disease is the most common blood disease children inherit from their parents. You will not know your child has the disease unless he or she is tested
Look out for the following signs and symptoms of sickle cell disease:
Yellow eyes, mouth, palms, and other parts of the body
Swelling and pain of the hands and feet
Children with sickle cell disease easily get malaria, pneumonia and other infections
To find out if your child has sickle cell disease, take him or her to the health facility for laboratory tests as soon as possible after birth
